setting.label: Host
setting.help_text: DNS name or IP address of the server hosting the database. Use 'localhost' to connect to the server using a Unix pipe.

setting.label: Port
setting.help_text: Connect to the database server on this port. MySQL uses '3306'.

setting.label: Ping
setting.help_text: Ping the remote server to confirm that it's on the network. You may need to disable this setting if you are blocking ICMP ping requests on the database server but are sure that it's available.

setting.label: User
setting.help_text: Database user name which has read and write privileges to MythTV tables.

setting.label: Host Identifier
setting.help_text: Unique identifier for this host in the database.

setting.label: Enabled
setting.help_text: If enabled, MythTV will attempt to wake the remote database host.

setting.label: Reconnect Count
setting.help_text: How often to attempt reconnecting to the database.

setting.label: Retry Count
setting.help_text: How often to attempt to wake the remote database host.

setting.label: Command
setting.help_text: Command to execute to wake the remote database host.
